name: POST_validations-email
description: **This endpoint allows you to validate an email address.**

email.description: The email address that you want to validate.

source.description: A one-word classifier for where this validation originated.

$ul: **checks**: Granular checks for email address validity.
**additional**: Additional checks on the email address.
**has_known_bounces**: WHether email sent to this address from your account has bounced.
**has_suspected_bounces**: Whether our model predicts that the email address might bounce.
**domain**: Checks on the domain portion of the email address.
**has_mx_or_a_record**: Whether the email has appropriate DNS records to deliver a message.
**has_valid_address_syntax**: Whether the email address syntax is valid.
**is_suspected_disposable_address**: Whether the domain appears to be from a disposable email address service.
**local_part**: Checks on the local part of the email address.
**is_suspected_role_address**: Whether the local part of email appears to be a role or group (e.g., hr, admin)
**host**: The domain of the email address.
**ip_address**: The IP address associated with this email.
**local**: The local part of the email address.
**score**: A numeric representation of the email validity.
**source**: The source of the validation, as per the API request.
**suggestion**: A suggested correction in the event of domain name typos (e.g., gmial.com)
**verdict**: A generic classification of whether or not the email address is valid.
